# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Data

wrap_string("This function will wrap words into lines")

```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width=10)
    wrapped_text = ""
    for word in split(text, " ")
        # Check if the current line is full
        if length(wrapped_text) + length(string(word))) > text_width
            # Add a newline and reset the line
            wrapped_text *= "\n"
            # Start a new line for the next word
            word = ""
        end
        # Append the word to the current line
        wrapped_text *= string(word)
    end
    return wrapped_text
end

# Example
text = "This function will wrap words into lines"
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text)
println(wrapped_text)
```
This code defines a `wrap_string` function that takes a text and a maximum width as input. The function iterates over each word in the text, checking if adding it to the current line would exceed the given width. If so, a newline is added and a new line is started for the next word. Finally, the wrapped text is returned.
